Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: IowaMusictravel
Reviews.Content: I don't have much to compare it with, since it is the only hotel I have stayed in within Paris city limits in ages, but I really thought it was quite nice. The room was small, but certainly big enough for me by myself. I really appreciated the free wireless internet, although there seemed to be some websites with which I could not connect, and I was unable to use Google voice to make free phone calls, which I had managed successfully in my hotel in Prague. The staff was great and always helpful. It was fun to be in a non-touristy area. I though the breakfast was a little expensive at 10 Euros, but I could go out the door in pretty much any direction, and within 4 or 5 blocks have my choice of boulangeries or patisseries at half that price. And the restaurant they recommended that was directly under my hotel room, Les Puces, was excellent! Quick access to the Metro was good, too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a weekend break”
Reviews.Author: Ros-Herts
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in March for three nights, and was very pleased with my choice. The hotel is in Les Batignolles, an area of Paris I didn't know, with a great a mix of vintage and interior design shops, small corner shops, little bars and restaurants. Not touristy, not pretentious, and very quick on the Metro to the centre of town. The room wasn't huge, but it was clean, with a very comfortable bed, full size mirror, small bath and shower. Free wi-fi, which was great. My room was at the front, looking out over the Rue Legendre, but it wasn't at all noisy. The only drawback was that there weren't any tea-making facilities in the room, but I found a travel kettle for 9 euros in a hardware shop nearby, and a nice mug in a fairtrade craft shop down the road, so that was easily sorted (I didn't think to borrow a kettle like another reviewer...). The staff seemed very nice and helpful. It was good value for money, and I'd certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “WOT A NICE STAFF!”
Reviews.Author: LuisOrtiz
Reviews.Content: We are a couple who work on hotel bussines in Playa del Carmen, Mexico, I must tell people working here are a TOP 10! anything we need was a goal to score for them! Vanessa and Cecile..hands DOWN! Hotel building is great, location is perfect, breakfast it is not the best...but We travellers love personal touch! Art Hotel its must to stay on Paris! Thank you so much! We did not really like Paris but people in Art Hotel made our stay pleasant and memorable! WE LOVE ART HOTEL BATIGNOLLES! by the way the lads on the restaurant next door have the best food in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Modern”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Whizz
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay here in March 2012. The hotel is about the same distance from Bronchant and La Fourche which are both on line 13 which is about a 10 minute walk. There are lots of bakeries, mini supermarkets, banks and a pharmacy near by.The area is quiet and more residential but there is a bar/restaurant next door but it's not too loud. It's within walking distance of Montmartre but remember it is a steep uphill walk. The staff were friendly and helpful - we asked for some hot water and they lent us a kettle! We were pleasantly surprised by the size of the room and décor; which is modern and tasteful. We looked at the floor plan of rooms and we had the biggest in the floor (106). However the difference between the others didn't look too great. The bathroom had a full sized bath but it is a small room with not shelf space for your toiletries. We ate breakfast outside at a cafe called Le \Panini where we had a sandwich and coffee and juice for around 10 euros for 2 people. Good value hotel with handy transport links around the city. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fashionable Parisian hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beach_Pengwin
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here during the bank holiday weekend in August and we had a great stay. The hotel was in a good location; being about a 10 minute walk to the metro station - La Fourche. The area doesn't look like the most friendly area, however, we never felt unsafe walking at night and there was always lots of people around. The hotel itself was lovely, the modern décor was very much appreciated and a big reason as to why we booked there. The room was a reasonable size for Paris as a lot of rooms in Paris can be quite small. The bed was very comfortable and the hotel was quiet so we had some very peaceful nights sleep! The bathroom was also very modern and fitted with a lovely shower. However, unfortunately on our last night of our 3 night stay, the hot water stopped working and the hotel was only left with freezing cold water. We could therefore not take a warm shower, which was necessary as we had been in the hot sun all day, and this continued through to the next morning. The staff were very apologetic regarding this and breakfast was offered to all the guests for free the following morning. This was unfortunate as sometimes these things can not be avoided but the staff were very good by keeping us updated and the free breakfast was good too. There were some nice restaurants and café's in the local area, including a great bakery just down the road and on a main square. There is also a beautiful park just off of the same square and it's good to take a stroll around the lake there and spot all of the wildlife. We definitely plan to come and stay here again, hopefully some time during this year!

Reviews.Title: “My Paris hotel of choice!”
Reviews.Author: MrsOverall666
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easy to find - tucked away on a side street just off the main road in the 17e so nice and quiet - and around 5-10 minutes away from two Metro stations, so you're well placed to explore Paris. Plenty of shops and banks and two restaurant/bars next door to the hotel and many more within 50 yards. My room was a decent size and spotlessly clean. The decor is sympathetic and modern, the beds and pillows are extremely comfortable and the television has a selection of channels available (though listed, BBC World channel wasn't on mine - though who goes to Paris to watch TV!). The rooms also have air conditioning, which is very handy when the weather is freezing cold outside. The bathroom was again spotlessly clean, with towels and shampoo/shower gel/soap provided. The water was lovely and hot and you can have a shower or a bath; the water pressure is powerful. The girl on reception was very friendly and helpful, spoke English and provided good maps of Paris and the Metro. There's also a vending machine in reception which is very handy if you get a 3am craving for chocolate. I didn't have breakfast as I needed a lie-in after the Indochine concert the previous night but it sounds like standard French/continental fare, which I like over a cooked breakfast. Overall, a great experience and I'll definitely stay here again next time I go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra_Toronto
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous and tucked away in the 17e. It is modern and clean with a beautiful bathroom (Choice of shower or tub? Get the tub.) and incredible view of the Paris street. It is in a safe neighborhood, close to the metro and lots of shops. Staff were very friendly and accommodating when I arrived earlier than expected. Would recommend to friends and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Spot”
Reviews.Author: Wahlumgirl
Reviews.Content: We spent several nights at the Art Hotel and were very happy with our choice (with the help of our Trip Advisor friends, of course!). Short walk to the metro but that metro takes you everywhere you need to go in no time. The hotel is on a quiet street off a main thoroughfare, yet our first night there we walked all around the area until quite late (2am?) and felt very at ease. Our room was actually larger than I expected for Paris, and nicely appointed in modern style. The front desk staff spoke English (which was good because my French is apparently horrible), and were very nice. I can't vouch for breakfast (was a little pricey), but what we experienced otherwise was just what we needed. Note: there is a 1 Euro per person city tax of sorts that is not included in the price of the room.

Reviews.Title: “November 2011 visit to Art Hotel Batignolles”
Reviews.Author: H R
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic very central for seeing all the main attractions, with lovely friendly restaurants really close by. Our room 306 on the third floor had lovely comfortable beds, with funky bedside lights, a small flat screen TV. A shower that was continually warm with a nice powerful shower which is always a bonus. Both the bedroom and the bathroom were good sizes. A few down sides, the wardrobe has a shelf in the middle of it, so ladies if you want to take a long dress it will be creased, as it only has the special hotel hangers which can not be used outside the wardrobe. The fridge although very handy is very loud especially when you are trying to sleep. The toilet roll holder had fallen off the wall and by the looks of the wall this had happend a few times and the holes had not been dealt with, not a big thing but a little unsighly and no where to put the toilet roll. Finally, although the beds were comfy, we had booked a double room as the trip was for a romantic weekend away and we were given a twin room, so not so romantic!

Reviews.Title: “Modernized rooms in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Rundgren
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Art Hotel. However, we were taken aback upon check out when the man at the front desk said we had to pay 1 euro, per person per night. That came out to 6 euro, which was not disclosed to us upon check in. Then, when we presented a 10 euro bill the host said he didn't have change. Hmmm. We got suspicious. We got a receipt but it said "non tax" under the title. That seemed completely opposite of what he said we had to pay: A Tax! We thought we got ripped off. Has this happened to anyone else????

Reviews.Title: “Scic and cosy!”
Reviews.Author: AM1984
Reviews.Content: I recently got to stay in Art Hotel and was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is in a quiet area close to the metro station and it takes less than 10 minutes to get to Champs Elysees, Musee de Louvre and beautiful Jardin des Tuileries. It is also within walking distance to Moulin Rouge. My only slight disappointment was breakfast. The service was very slow and there wasn't much choice of food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: RoJo36
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a very high level of service and clean rooms with all facilities you can expect for this level. We never tried the breakfast since there were plenty of places around for just that. The metro station was within easy walking distance and some sights (e.g. The Sacre-Coeur and Montmartre) as well.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied with our stay”
Reviews.Author: flexjones
Reviews.Content: We arrived early(11.30am) at the beginning of our three night stay and we were luckly enough to get an excellent room on the third floor. The room was spacious for a Paris hotel and was well presented with nice furnishings. Wifi was free in the hotel, however, I didn't use it. The bed was very comfortable with cool LED bedside lamps. The ensuite was clean with modern bathware and a large shower. The finishing on the tiling could have been better along the doorway and there was a small stain on the carpet outside the en-suite door where water may have leaked out. Towels were changed each day and showergel and shampoo were provided. The hotel was in a nice safe area with a few friendly bars nearby. There are two Metro stations within a few minutes walk, to transport you to anywhere in central Paris. The hotel reception staff were courtious and had good spoken English. I didn't try the breakfast. I feel €12 is a bit steep for a continental breakfast. Overall I would recommend this hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely Hotel - nice location!”
Reviews.Author: NB_JG
Reviews.Content: Having just come back from Paris, I cannot fault the hotel at all, in a lovely area, emailed the hotel prior to us getting there and they forfilled our request without any issues. The area is nice, very multi-cultural, nice restaurants all around, safe, didn't have any issues walking around late at night. The metro is 10 mins walk and gets you in the main parts of Paris within minutes. The bus '54' goes straight to the Gare Du Nord if you don't want to use the Metro. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Twin beds for a romantic Paris weekend”
Reviews.Author: expatinsingapore
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with a specific request for a double bedded room last Saturday. When I tried to check in I was assured that they would reallocate us from the twin bedded room on the 1st floor to a double on the 5th if we came back later. Having carried our hand baggage all day in Paris, we returned to the hotel at 6pm only to be given a twin bedded on the 1st floor. Their excuse " Sorry we don't have too many double beds and everyone wants one so we gave it to someone else". So my advise is if bedding type is important to you, don't risk it. Other than that, the room was small but clean. The area is not great and 8 minutes from the metro and 12 euros in a taxi from most central places.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SilverD11
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights and would return. Rooms were very clean and staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: MTGD
Reviews.Content: Two of us stayed at the Arte Hotel Batignolles in April for a few days. It’s a charming small hotel, comfortable, very clean, and quiet. The rooms are small for N. American standards, but had everything we needed. The beds were super comfortable, and there was air-conditioning and free wi-fi. Just two (very minor) suggestions: the modern interior design was nice, but the walls were starkly bare - some pictures or art would make the room warmer and more welcoming. Also wished the bathrooms had more counter/shelf space. The continental breakfasts were lovely, with fresh bread, cheeses, yogurt, and pastries. Sometimes you could boil your own egg too, although these weren’t replenished as often. There are some very nice restaurants downstairs/next door/down the street. Great local, un-touristy ambiance, and some of the best meals I had this trip! The hotel is slightly away from the main sights - about 15 min by subway to Champs Elysees, 25 min to the Left Bank. It’s about 7 min walk to La Fourche subway (Brochant is slightly closer, but sometimes have to change lines anyways). We also walked from the hotel to Montmartre (about 15 mins) and to LaFayette (about 30 mins). The staff were polite and helpful, and most spoke English well. All in all, great value. We booked online as part of a package with our flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great - loved it”
Reviews.Author: oliverstrub
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went there with our 2 kids (12 and 14), and had three rooms. We very much appreciated the friendly, helpful and effective receptionists and other staff. The rooms were very clean, nicely designed - shower, aircon and fridge worked perfectly. The hotel is located somewhat away from the main attractions, but is in a quarter that is lovely: not noisy, but just lively, with quite a few bars and restaurants in the neighborhood. The next metro station (La Fourche) is about a 5 to 7m to walk. Wireless is great and works even in the bar/restaurant just adjacent to the hotel. Highlights of the breakfast were certainly the butter croissants and the coffee. We also liked that the hotel has only about 15 rooms. As always, there is room to improve: the fridge in my room was a little bit noisy when running and every time you accessed the wireless, you had to enter username and password. Very minor stuff indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheOrion
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay at the hotel in June. The room was modern and comfortable and I had a lovely view over the street and neighbouring buildings from one of the top floors. It was my first stay in this area of Paris and I enjoyed it very much, even walked to Place St Pierre (not very short walk but rather pleasant during which it was exciting and enjoyable to explore (for me) a new part of the city). I would certainly recommend this hotel as a good choice for business travellers and those tired of Quartier Latin and other traditional touristic areas.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed expectations!”
Reviews.Author: vahlrona
Reviews.Content: Normally pictures always show a prettier picture than what in fact meets you when you arrive to the hotel. Not this time. The hotel rooms are nice and clean, the staff very friendly and the area accessible. WiFi worked well during our stay. I would recommend Art Batignolles to anyone traveling for leisure. Ps. For anyone that is disturbed by city sounds it might be good to know that there is a neat little restaurant just below the hotel windows on Rue Legendre. If that troubles you - a good idea would be to ask for a room a bit higher up in the building.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Jenny007Athens
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Art Hotel for 3 nights in the middle of March and did really enjoyed our stay. The staff was very polite, helpful and spoke fluent English. The room was as big as it was needed and very clean.The hotel is situated in a nice neighbourhood, next to the metro and in walking distance to Montmartre and the Sacre Coeur. Overall, our experience with Art Hotel was positive and we strongly recommend it to any future visitors.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: VickReeves
Reviews.Content: I spent about 20 days in this hotel while I was inbetween places and I was very happy staying there. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were very clean. The bed was very comfortable. And I liked where the hotel is located - away from the tourists and not too far from Montmartre.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly service, newly renovated rooms and best price for service”
Reviews.Author: jess277
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located between two metro stations which makes it easy to get into town. The are around offers many nice restraurants, bakery, café bar.. Furthermore you can easily walk to Montmartre for a night out. Rooms are very clean and newly renovated. The service is very good, staff speaks perfectly English and the staff at the receptions is very helpful.. all in all a great place to spend some days for visiting Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Once again I had a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: x-y-z-d10
Reviews.Content: I returned to Art Hotel Batignolles again on my most recent trip to Paris, 15-21 Dec. My original booking was for 4 nights, but due to snow in the Paris region on the 19-Dec-2010 I had to extend my stay for an extra 2 days. Once again I found all staff members to be very helpful and courteous during my stay. On check in Cici was pleasant and friendly when she checked me into my room a little earlier than the official check in time, and she had a smile on her face each time I saw her. This time I was in a different room to my last stay, it was a very large size (Room x05) and allowed plenty of space for my baggage and me. Hicham (I am not sure if I have this man’s name correct) was very helpful in providing me with information on pub’s and bar’s in the area when my friend and I wanted to go out on Friday night for a quite drink. We found the following Bar to be very nice and cosy: West Bar, 61 Rue Legendre, 75017 Paris, France +33 1 46 27 31 59 ‎ http://www.cityvox.co.uk/bar_paris/west-bar_200037794/profile-place On the Sunday when my flight was cancelled I returned to the Hotel and Samy was extremely helpful in arranging for an extra 2 nights in the hotel at a rate that was the same as my original booking. I see that the hotel has a new customer relation’s manager, Julie, who takes time to respond to the comments made here. This seems to be a very good idea and should help maintain the very high level of customer service I have seen to date. Once again this hotel (and it’s sister hotel) will top of my list for my next return to Paris. Joanna should be proud of all her staff and hotel, wishing you all a prosperous new year.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money IF you can get a discount rate”
Reviews.Author: espruytte
Reviews.Content: New hotel in an OK neighborhood relatively close to two metro stations (400 meters walk to La Fourche). You need less than 15 minutes to reach Les Champs Elysées from the hotel. THE good thing about this hotel are the very modern and clean rooms with flat screen tv, individual electronic A/C running even at the end of October, and last but not least a very nice but small bathroom with a superb shower cabin. Please note that the "large" beds only measure 140 cm by 200 cm, which is typical for rather small Parisian hotel rooms, but these are very comfortable. They offer FREE high speed WiFi in the room: it was lightning fast !! We did not have breakfast in the breakfast room in the basement because it looked a bit dark with no windows. The buffet breakfast did look ok but we preferred to have it outside the hotel. Next to the hotel, there is a busy restaurant called Les Puces de Batignolles which we do recommend. There is another restaurant which we liked a lot named Ripaille in a street about 800 meters away from the hotel: excellent! You will find reviews for both on Tripadvisor. Hotel employees were very kind and reacted fast to any query. Published rate of 170 EUR is rather high, but we managed to get a discount weekend rate of 99 EUR without breakfast by booking directly on their web site at http://www.arthotelbatignolles.com/ The rooms look exactly as advertised on their web site.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern and central - a hidden gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: marekz
Reviews.Content: Central in terms of being close to the metro, that's all you need. And with late night open shops, restaurants surrounding the area, it turned out to be the perfect place for our 3 nights visit to Paris. Paris is known to have small hotel rooms, and this was no exception. But, the rooms were very smart furnished, with LED TV and other smart solutions. The bathroom was actually not that small, to be fair - it had OK size. And everything was brand new. The staff were very helpful, and they all spoke good English. We also strongly recommend the restaurant "Les Puces des Batignolles", it shares the same address as the hotel. We went there for two dinners, and one brunch. It is rated as one of the better restaurants in Paris, search for it here on Tripadvisor. Locals were eating at the restaurants, that is always a good sign. However, if Parisian food is not your type of food, there is a McDonald's close by the hotel, too (just by the "La Fourche" metro station). On the negative side, they advertise with free WIFI, and that may be true, had it only worked. We never managed to connect. Once it connected, it was down the next second. The staff tried to fix it during our stay, but did not manage to do that. All in all, we will probably book this one again on our next Paris trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: BumbleBee10_10
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. Myself and my boyfriend went in september and had nothing to complain about when we left. Were from Ireland and was our first time in Paris so didnt know the area but got used to the metro very quickly. Its 2 metro stops and a small walk. Area is brilliant. Theres shops and restuarants surrounding the hotel. The area was very safe. The rooms were exactly how the pictures on the website show. There is a flat screen tv in the room with a dvd player. Air conditioning was very handy. Shower was very powerful. The staff were very friendly and all spoke english. I would definitely recommend this hotel:)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with Great staff”
Reviews.Author: x-y-z-d10
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at this hotel during its first week of opening. During this time I found all staff members to be both helpful and courteous in dealing with any request or query I had. Location wise the Hotel is in between 2 metro stops Brochant and La Fourche station on Metro line 13. I choose to use the La Fourche station as the Metro line splits in two here and you could choose the wrong branch line. The rooms were of a good size for a hotel in Paris, clean and with good air conditioning systems. The room had a nice colour scheme with solid and well built furniture. The finish in both the room and bathroom was of a high standard. Bathroom / Shower was clad in stone for the floor and walls with chunky/solid fixtures and fittings. Water pressure and temperature in the shower was very good. The rooms are fitted with a proximity keycard which needs to be left with reception when you are not in your room. I though this slightly odd, in other hotel I have been to in Paris they used an old fashioned key on a large keyring which had to be left at reception. With this new type of credit card sized electronic key I would assume you keep it with you when out and about. Just outside the hotel are 2 café / bar establishments, both looked good and were open from early to late. I did not go in to them but they always had customers. I did not notice any noise from them in my room. They could be an option for a nightcap. The hotel offers breakfast at an additional cost, I did not take this option. As well as price another part of my reason to choose this hotel was the free WiFi which worked very well in my room and also in the lobby / reception area. As it was a new Hotel I had a small issue with the password on my first day but both ladies working in reception were very helpful in obtaining the correct password for me. During my stay the owner of the hotel was in the lobby while I was talking to reception. She introduced herself and asked my opinion of my stay. She was very eager to hear my opinion and was also excited to tell me about the hotel. Unfortunately I had just returned from spending the morning walking around the city and was hot and tired so I was not in the humour for talking at that time. I did not get the chance to see her again to give her more information. This is why I have taken the time to writ this review. Over all the Hotel is well designed and rooms are nice and comfortable. The two ladies on reception who I mostly saw during the day were very very helpful and friendly to deal with.

HotelInfo.Name: Art Hotel Batignolles
HotelInfo.Address: 110 rue Legendre, 75017 Paris, France
